hbm_chnl_4x_wide_hbm_rd_to_wr_arbitratio.desc: Configuration for LUT that controls switching from read to write. The 7 criteria in above register are translated to 128b vector, where a 1 means move to write on that combination LUT bit 0: Total \# of rd requests <= MinStayRdRequests LUT bit 1: Total \# of eligible rd banks <= MinStayRdEligibleBanks LUT bit 2: Total \# of non-empty rd banks (even if not eligible) <= MinStayRdValidBanks LUT bit 3: Total \# of wr requests > MinMoveToWrRequests LUT bit 4: Total \# of eligible wr banks > MinMoveToWrEligibleBanks LUT bit 5: Total \# of requests served > RdRequestsServed LUT bit 6: Total \# of cycles elapsed since last switch > RdTotalCycles

hbm_chnl_4x_wide_hbm_wr_to_rd_arbitratio.desc: Configuration for LUT that controls switching from write  to read The 7 criteria in above register are translated to 128b vector, where a 1 means move to read  on that combination LUT bit 0: Total \# of wr requests <= MinStayWrRequests LUT bit 1: Total \# of eligible wr banks <= MinStayWrEligibleBanks LUT bit 2: Total \# of non-empty wr banks (even if not eligible) <= MinStayWrValidBanks LUT bit 3: Total \# of rd requests > MinMoveToRdRequests LUT bit 4: Total \# of eligible rd banks > MinMoveToRdEligibleBanks LUT bit 5: Total \# of requests served > WrRequestsServed LUT bit 6: Total \# of cycles elapsed since last switch > WrTotalCycles

hbm_chnl_4x_wide_mmu_lpm_read_arbitratio.desc: Configuration for arbitration btwn LPM and MMU read requests

Number of elements currently in cache. When cache is active, this register is managed by the Design. Because each cahce is read only when packet arrives with the corresponding LB-Key, it is posibble that before changing another group-size, the cache-count will not be 0. for this reason: Before changing Group-size of another gourp-id, If (cache-counter =! 0) then the User should do the following: a. Write 0 to all entries in the cache-table (that�s done for reser the �valid� bit in the table) b. Write 0 to this registen (cache-count = 0)

idb_res_slice_port_dsp_lb_consistence_at.desc: Consistence attributes is an external register used to inform the design that a group-size had been changed, and start a consistency sequence. 1. When Group-size changed, the user should write to the external regs the following: a. Valid = 1'b1 b. Cache-Group-id (the group which had changed) c. Prev-group-size (the value which is found in the group-size-table) d. Current-group-size (the new group-size = Prev-group-size�1) e. Timer-value (32b in clks resolution) //this starts the �learn� timer f. Removed-member-id + valid (if group-size decreased) 2. Before changing Group-size of another gourp-id, write to the external regs the following: a. Valid = 1'b0

idb_res_idb_interrupts_mask.desc: This register masks idb_interrupts interrupt register

idb_res_idb_interrupts_test.desc: This register tests idb_interrupts interrupt register

idb_res_dest_decoding.desc: Between each stage in the resolution pipe, The five (5) most significant bits of destination are mapped to describe the required processing. This register contains the data required to resolve the next resolution logic

idb_res_pbts_map_native_lp.desc: Table-index is: {QOS(3b), Profile(2)} Table-Index = ((Destination[17:2] AND {And-Mask,13�b0}) << Destination-Shift) + PBTS-Offset

idb_res_pbts_map_path_lp.desc: Table-index is: {QOS(3b), Profile(2)} Table-Index = ((Destination[17:2] AND {And-Mask,13�b0}) << Destination-Shift) + PBTS-Offset

idb_res_slice_native_lb_group_size_table.desc: Native-LB-Group-Size-Table: If:   payload.enable-consistence == 1'b1 &&    (consistence-regs.valid == 1'b1) &&    (consistence-regs.group-id == in-group-id) than Consistence logic is done for the member-id-calculation Else: Regular member-id-calculation (according to payload.group-size and in-lb-key)

idb_res_slice_path_lb_group_size_table.desc: Path-LB-Group-Size-Table: If:   payload.enable-consistence == 1'b1 &&    (consistence-regs.valid == 1'b1) &&    (consistence-regs.group-id == in-group-id) than Consistence logic is done for the member-id-calculation Else: Regular member-id-calculation (according to payload.group-size and in-lb-key)

idb_res_slice_port_npp_lb_group_size_tab.desc: Port-NPP-LB-Group-Size-Table: If:   payload.enable-consistence == 1'b1 &&    (consistence-regs.valid == 1'b1) &&    (consistence-regs.group-id == in-group-id) than Consistence logic is done for the member-id-calculation Else: Regular member-id-calculation (according to payload.group-size and in-lb-key)

idb_res_slice_port_dsp_lb_group_size_tab.desc: Port-DSP-LB-Group-Size-Table: If:   payload.enable-consistence == 1'b1 &&    (consistence-regs.valid == 1'b1) &&    (consistence-regs.group-id == in-group-id) than Consistence logic is done for the member-id-calculation Else: Regular member-id-calculation (according to payload.group-size and in-lb-key)

idb_top_init_done_status_register.desc: This block contains some memories which are being initialized by the design after soft-reset (for example: xor-memories, EMDBs). This register contains the status of the init-sequence.

idb_top_debug_data_bus_register.desc: This register will contain selected-data-bus for debug. The selected data is taken from a full data-bus which can be seen in idb_top_dbg.v file.

idb_top_bubble_logic_counter_cfg.desc: This block contains Strict-Priority logic for some of the databases. In order to avoid starvation of the lower-priority-databases, a bubble-request will be sent from those in the case their input-fifos are ready, but for more than <x> clocks there was no pop from them. <x> can be different for each database, and is controlled by this register

idb_top_disable_link_relay_cfg.desc: There are 2 phisical-relay-attributes table in this block: 1. Large relay-table (12K) 2. Small relay-table (4K) There are 2 device modes related to the relay-tables 1. Both Link-relay (for simple-bridge) and Service-relay (for Service-bridge) are used 2. Only Service-relay (for service-bridge) is used When the link relay attributes is not used its memory may be used to extend the relay attributes table.

idb_top_vlan_mapping_table.desc: vlan_mapping_table (one table for two slice-pairs) The table result is calculated as follows: Result = Entry.Hit ? {1�b0, Entry.Result}  : {1�b1, Key.Default-Result} Hit = Entry.Hit

sdb_mac_per_slice_sm1_mask_cfg.desc: when 'two-tables-access' is set (access-sm1=='1' in sm0-key-ctrls), lookup from SM-1 will be done with: Key = (SM0-key (50) & cfg-mask (50)) NOTE: Used for inserting Port|Vlan|Vlan and Port|Vlan simultanously to both SM-table, priority to P|V|V

sdb_mac_sm_per_em_core_selected_access_i.desc: The service mapping table is shared between all slices in the device. It is composed of 16 exact match cores connected to 48 banks of 4K entries. The exact match core and bank connectivity structure allows for different allocations of entries to slices.  This register controls for each slice and key-0/1, which EM will be accessed

pdvoq_slice5_cpu_return_context.desc: CPU return context to the dynamic context allocation machine. One use is in case of aged out queue.

pdvoq_slice5_cpu_return_context_status.desc: CPU may/may-not return context to the dynamic context allocation machine. One use is in case of aged out queue.

pdvoq_slice5_buffers_consumption_lut_for.desc: LUT for dequeue marking in VOQ-CGM based on Buffer Consumption. Index in Array is {Profile,BufferAvailableLevel} Profile is 5 bits BufferAvailableLevel is quantized to 2 bits.

pdvoq_slice5_pd_consumption_lut_for_deq.desc: LUT for dequeue marking in VOQ-CGM based on Pd Consumption. Decision is taken from offset {Profile,PktAvailableLevel} Profile is 5 bits PktAvailableLevel is quantized to 2 bits.

pdvoq_slice5_voq_cgm_enq_time_fifo_cfg.desc: Config Register for fifo that stores the enq time of a PD between read report and Deq Cmd

pdvoq_slice5_rdrqsn.desc: Read request sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number. The sequence number is incremented (RMW) every read-request command and written to an old sequence number value in case the ICS asks for retransmit (on dequeue-command).

pdvoq_slice5_rdsn.desc: Read sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number.  The sequence number is incremented every dequeue-command from the ICS and read every enqueue-command by the write-queue-manager.

pdvoq_slice5_rdbc.desc: Read bytes count, entry per queue, initialized to 0. The read bytes count is incremented (RMW) with the packet size every dequeue-command from the ICS, and read every enqueue-command, 2R+W memory.

pdvoq_slice5_rdbufcnt.desc: Similar to rdbc but in SMS buffers. CGM need to know the queue size in SMS buffer units. SMS buffer is 384B.

pdvoq_slice5_wrrqsn.desc: Write request sequence number, entry per queue. Each entry is initialized to the entry number (in order to prevent pressure on the first exact-match core). The sequence number is incremented by the write-queue-manager (RMW) every enqueue-command, R+W (Two ports) memory.

pdvoq_slice5_wrsn.desc: Write sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number.  The sequence number increments every write report (read-increment-write) and read every De-queue command, 2R+W memory.

pdvoq_slice5_wrbc.desc: Write bytes count, entry per queue, initialized to 0.  The write bytes count is incremented (RMW) in packet size every write-report and read every dequeue-command, 2R+W memory.

pdvoq_slice5_wrbufcnt.desc: Similar to wrbc but in SMS buffers. CGM need to know the queue size in SMS buffer units. SMS buffer is 384B.

pdvoq_slice5_voq2context.desc: context per voq. Managed by the context mapper.  Read by ICS when it receives credit-grant and need to translate the VOQ\# to context.

pdvoq_slice5_cand_rel_fifo.desc: Fifo to hold context\# released by the ICS

pdvoq_slice5_in_cand_rel_fifo_set.desc: The context resides in the CandRelFifo - set-clear-read to prevent double entries in the fifo

pdvoq_slice5_in_cand_rel_fifo_clr.desc: The context resides in the CandRelFifo - set-clear-read to prevent double entries in the fifo

pdvoq_slice5_context_release_eligible_se.desc: The context is empty and thus ready for release SCRP

pdvoq_slice5_context_release_eligible_cl.desc: The context is empty and thus ready for release SCRP

pdvoq_slice5_context_in_dram_set.desc: The context is in the DRAM and thus it is not ready for release SCR

pdvoq_slice5_context_in_dram_clr.desc: The context is in the DRAM and thus it is not ready for release SCR

pdvoq_slice5_context_map_valid_set.desc: The context is mapped to VOQ (SCR)

pdvoq_slice5_context_map_valid_clr.desc: The context is mapped to VOQ (SCR)

pdvoq_slice5_contextfbm_bmp.desc: bitmap memory for the free buffer manager

pdvoq_slice5_new_voq_set.desc: This context is a new-voq (first credit grant did not arrive / first PD was not transmitted)

pdvoq_slice5_new_voq_clr.desc: This context is a new-voq (first credit grant did not arrive / first PD was not transmitted)

pdvoq_slice5_voq_properties.desc: context per voq. Managed by the context mapper.  Read by ICS when it receives credit-grant and need to translate the VOQ\# to context.

pdvoq_slice5_static_mapping.desc: Mark the static context so they want be reused - returned to the pool

pdvoq_slice5_context2voq.desc: credit allocate read port for credit grant

pdvoq_slice5_rqm_free_fifo.desc: fifo for dequeue between RQM and the EMCs

pdvoq_slice5_voqcgm_profile.desc: Dynamic CGM profile per context used by voq_cgm

pdvoq_slice5_dram_cgm_profile.desc: Global Portion of Profiles for admission test. For every CGM profile define the action of the WRED mechanism (i.e. drop or mark) and the probabilty of the action when the queue size is in each of the WRED regions.

pdvoq_slice5_profile_buff_region_thresho.desc: Per Profile Thresholds for max queue size in buffers to be included in Region X. i.e. if QsizeBuffRegion0 < QsizeBuff <= QsizeBuffRegion1 then the region is 1. If QsizeBuffRegion6 < QsizeBuff the region is 7

pdvoq_slice5_profile_pkt_region_threshol.desc: Per Profile Thresholds for max queue size in PDs to be included in Region X. i.e. if QsizePktRegion0 < QsizePkts <= QsizePktRegion1 then the region is 1. If QsizePktRegion6 < QsizePkts the region is 7

pdvoq_slice5_profile_pkt_enq_time_region.desc: Per Profile Thresholds for Voq-Delay to be in Region X. i.e. if PdEnqTimeRegion0 < Qdelay <= PdEnqTimeRegion1 then region is 1. If PdEnqTimeRegion14 < Qdelay region is 15

pdvoq_slice5_buffers_consumption_lut_for.desc: CGM Enqueue test LUT for queue size in buffers. The result of the test is a decision for DropGreen, DropYellow, EvictToDram and CongestionMark. Every entry in memory holds 16 bits for each decision type and the final decision is selected based on the 4 bit quantized queue delay level. Address in memory is: {Profile,DramContextAvailable,RxpdrIngressCounterRegion,VoqSizeBuffersLevel} Profile is 5 bits. DramContextAvailable is 1 bit and is received from the ICS. RxpdrIngressCounterRegion is 2 bits of Rxpdr's CounterA Utilization level. VoqSizeBuffersLevel is 3 bits and is the quantized queue size in buffers based on ProfileBuffRegionThresholds Memory.

pdvoq_slice5_pd_consumption_lut_for_enq.desc: CGM Enqueue test LUT for queue size in PDs. The result of the test is a decision for DropGreen, DropYellow, EvictToDram and CongestionMark. Every entry in memory holds 16 bits for each decision type and the final decision is selected based on the 4 bit quantized queue delay level. Address in memory is: {Profile,PdvoqPdCounter0Level,VoqSizePdsLevel} CGM logic implemented in memory. Profile is 5 bits. PdvoqPdCounter0Level is 2 bits of PDVOQ's PD Counter 0  Utilization level. VoqSizePdsLevel is 3 bits and is the quantized queue size in PDs based on ProfilePktRegionThresholds Memory.

pdvoq_slice5_voq_enq_rpt_size_for_enq.desc: Enq Report Qsize region per context for Enq pipe

pdvoq_slice5_voq_deq_rpt_size_for_enq.desc: Deq Report Qsize region per context for Enq pipe

pdvoq_slice5_voq_enq_rpt_size_for_deq.desc: Enq Report Qsize region per context for Enq pipe

pdvoq_slice5_voq_deq_rpt_size_for_deq.desc: Deq Report Qsize region per context for Enq pipe

pdvoq_slice5_last_rpt_enq_set_mem_extra.desc: Set part of Set Clear Red Memory Needs to be initiated to 0

pdvoq_slice5_last_rpt_enq_clr_mem.desc: Clr part of Set Clear Red Memory Needs to be initiated to 0

pdvoq_slice5_last_rpt_enq_clr_mem_extra.desc: Clr part of Set Clear Red Memory Needs to be initiated to 0

pdvoq_slice5_head_time_enq_set_mem.desc: Set part of Set Clear Red Memory Needs to be initiated to 0

pdvoq_slice5_head_time_enq_set_mem_extra.desc: Set part of Set Clear Red Memory Needs to be initiated to 0

pdvoq_slice5_head_time_enq_clr_mem.desc: Clr part of Set Clear Red Memory Needs to be initiated to 0

pdvoq_slice5_is_aging_clr_mem.desc: Set part of Set Clear Red Memory Needs to be initiated to 0

dvoq_encap_compensation_config_register.desc: Encapsulation Compensation configurations. Values are signed numbers, Must be set from most negative to most positive. When a dram buffer descriptor arrives with packets that require encapsulation compensation the compensation is accumulated per dram context. Compensation can be negative or positive. Once the accumulated value is negative enough or positive enough we compensate for it with the closest quantization value. The fields of this register define the quantization levels of the accumulated compensation value.

dvoq_rrpm.desc: Read request pointer memory, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the reserved invalid value 20'hfffff. Read Modify Write every read request command, also writen from enq pipe if queue is empty.  Two port memory.

dvoq_qsm.desc: Queue Size memory, entry per queue, size of the queue in buffers, bytes and buffers ending in eop. Initialized to zeros. Read Modify Write every en-queue and read command, Two port memory.

hbm_chnl_4x_tall_hbm_rd_to_wr_arbitratio.desc: Configuration for LUT that controls switching from read to write. The 7 criteria in above register are translated to 128b vector, where a 1 means move to write on that combination LUT bit 0: Total \# of rd requests <= MinStayRdRequests LUT bit 1: Total \# of eligible rd banks <= MinStayRdEligibleBanks LUT bit 2: Total \# of non-empty rd banks (even if not eligible) <= MinStayRdValidBanks LUT bit 3: Total \# of wr requests > MinMoveToWrRequests LUT bit 4: Total \# of eligible wr banks > MinMoveToWrEligibleBanks LUT bit 5: Total \# of requests served > RdRequestsServed LUT bit 6: Total \# of cycles elapsed since last switch > RdTotalCycles

hbm_chnl_4x_tall_hbm_wr_to_rd_arbitratio.desc: Configuration for LUT that controls switching from write  to read The 7 criteria in above register are translated to 128b vector, where a 1 means move to read  on that combination LUT bit 0: Total \# of wr requests <= MinStayWrRequests LUT bit 1: Total \# of eligible wr banks <= MinStayWrEligibleBanks LUT bit 2: Total \# of non-empty wr banks (even if not eligible) <= MinStayWrValidBanks LUT bit 3: Total \# of rd requests > MinMoveToRdRequests LUT bit 4: Total \# of eligible rd banks > MinMoveToRdEligibleBanks LUT bit 5: Total \# of requests served > WrRequestsServed LUT bit 6: Total \# of cycles elapsed since last switch > WrTotalCycles

hbm_chnl_4x_tall_hbm_more_timing_paramet.desc: Timing parameters from HBM standard. NOTE: All times are in terms of DRAM clock (nomimal 1 GHZ)! Defaults are according to Hynix spec. Cycles must be rounded upwards if division by clock cycle is not integer

mmu_buff_cpu_override_buffers.desc: CPU access to free up buffers in the free buffer allocator. The 4 LSbs of the buffer number serve as selector for buffer allocator , and the other 16b are written here

cdb_cache_splitter_cache_activity_offset.desc: the activity timestamp is driven from a 32bit register. This value determines the start point from which the activity timestamp is taken.

cdb_cache_splitter_cache_random_delete_o.desc: when a cache entry is hit by rxpp lookup, and an lfsr output value equale to this value - the entry will be deleted. Setting this value to 0 will disable the feature.

cdb_cache_splitter_cache_static_tcam_ent.desc: when a cache entry is hit by rxpp lookup, and an lfsr output value equale to this value - the entry will be deleted. Setting this value to 0 will disable the feature.

cdb_cache_splitter_cache_mask_reg.desc: masking for key on insertion and lkp, satrts from lsb of the key

cdb_cache_splitter_cache_ignore_cem_repl.desc: when set cem replies will not be insertetd to the cach

cdb_cache_lpm_cache_disable_cache_tcam_r.desc: rxpp lookups in the cache tcam will always result in a miss when this bit is set

cdb_cache_lpm_cache_insert_period_regist.desc: number of clocks the insert machine will stall between attempts to insert new data to cache.

cdb_cache_lpm_cache_age_threshold_regist.desc: entries with age older than this value will be removed by the scanner.

cdb_cache_lpm_cache_activity_offset_regi.desc: the activity timestamp is driven from a 32bit register. This value determines the start point from which the activity timestamp is taken.

cdb_cache_lpm_cache_hash_cfg_register.desc: configures the hash of the EM-s in the cache

cdb_cache_lpm_cache_full_len_hit.desc: defines what is full hit len for ipv4 and ipv6.  entries that came back from cdb with full hit len are initially inserted to the EM. If EM is full, inserted to the TCAM.

cdb_cache_splitter_cache_age_mem.desc: age of entries that resides in one of the EM wrappers. Each mem line holds the following stat per 4 entries : valid(1),type(1,v6 or v4),couple_v6_entry_bin(1),age(2).  Bits [19:15],[14:10] of mem line is for bin1,bin0 in the msb_em, and bits [9:5],[4:0] for bin1,bin0 in the lsb_em.

cdb_cache_splitter_cache_activity_mem.desc: holds the activity timesstamp(last time the entry was hit) per entry in the cache. There are  1k*2 + 1k*2+ 128 entries in the cache

cdb_cache_lpm_cache_age_mem.desc: age of entries that resides in one of the EM wrappers. Each mem line holds the following stat per 4 entries : valid(1),type(1,v6 or v4),couple_v6_entry_bin(1),age(2).  Bits [19:15],[14:10] of mem line is for bin1,bin0 in the msb_em, and bits [9:5],[4:0] for bin1,bin0 in the lsb_em.

npe_lookup_results_cfg.desc: Per macro: 1. The width in bytes of each lookup result 2. Final Result Shift-value (in channles-resolution)

npe_pd_update_instructions.desc: Instructions to udpate packet descriptor. Instruction

npe_mini_scoper_cfg.desc: select the source of each channel in the data-bus between lookup-core and resolution-core

rxpp_fwd_cache_interrupt_reg_test.desc: This register tests cache_interrupt_reg interrupt register

rxpp_fwd_cfg_tx_header_width.desc: Width of the tx header, which is the first part of the packet being stripped before entring the NPU

rxpp_fwd_frag_error_entry_reg.desc: When the frag memory has multiple parity errors on  a memory address, this register is used to remove the address from the frag memory address manager

rxpp_fwd_pd_construction_congurations.desc: Configurations for constructing the NPU (SMS) header from the Forwarding stage

rxpp_fwd_dual_homing_redirect_destinatio.desc: Change RxPP.FWD_destination to this value, if SNA.dual_homing is set

rxpp_fwd_tcam_comp_ldb_to_profile.desc: Maps the 5 LSBs of the TCAM key to compression-profile and compression-valid indiaction

rxpp_fwd_tcam_range_compression_profile.desc: There are 8 TCAM key compression profiles

rxpp_fwd_tcam_range_compression_ranges.desc: There are four sets of ranges. Each set has 16 ranges. Each range has an upper limit and a lower limit. A value is inside a range if Value >= Range-Lower-Limit and Value <= Range-Upper-Limit

rxpp_fwd_resolution_load_balancing_conf.desc: Configurations for the resolution LB key generation, at the output of the FWD NPE lookup access

rxpp_fwd_db_splitter_lp_to_mask_conf.desc: Map the NPP[13:12] returning from the CDB splitter, to 8 bits mask before inserting to the NPE

rxpp_fwd_db_splitter_result_standartizat.desc: When unset, the CDB splitter result doesn't undergo standardization

rxpp_fwd_ctm_fwd_db_mapping_reg.desc: Map the 2 LSBs of the Central TCAM access key, to which DB responses are expected

rxpp_fwd_res_acc0_db_mapping_reg.desc: Map the 6 LSBs of the resolution LB key 0 access key, to which DB responses are expected

rxpp_fwd_res_acc2_db_mapping_reg.desc: Map the 2 LSBs of the resolution em key access key, to which DB responses are expected

rxpp_fwd_dbc_thresholds_reg.desc: The number of remaining free entries in the DB result container, before the lookup access rate of relevant DBs is reduced to 1 every 2 clocks

rxpp_fwd_ipv4_error_checks.desc: Which error checks to perform for IPv4 headers (between termination and forwarding stages)

rxpp_fwd_ethernet_error_checks.desc: Which error checks to perform for Ethernet headers (between termination and forwarding stages)

rxpp_fwd_term2fwd_err_header_type_mappin.desc: Map the FWD header type (out of termination stage) to network header type, for error checking

rxpp_fwd_res_lb_header_type_mapping_reg.desc: Configurations for the hardwired Resolution LB Key calculation, between the termination and forwarding stages

rxpp_fwd_res_lb_profile_fs_insturctions_.desc: Maps the current and next header profiles to two field select configurations and a mask

rxpp_fwd_res_lb_key_const_config_reg.desc: Constant configuration for the hardwired Resolution LB Key calculation, between the termination and forwarding stages

rxpp_fwd_learn_records.desc: memory in learn record buffer to hold records until signal from reassebly

rxpp_fwd_fec_table.desc: FEC mapping table. Map the 5 LSBs of the LPM destination

rxpp_fwd_fec_table_access_map_reg.desc: Map the 5 MSBs of the LPM destination, to whether FEC Mapping should be performed or not

rxpp_fwd_snoop_code_to_mirror_cmd0.desc: Map the snoop code to mirror command 0

rxpp_fwd_mirror_code_to_mirror_cmd1.desc: Map the mirror code to mirror command 1

rxpp_fwd_nppd_dest_to_pd_dest.desc: Map the 6 MSBs of NPPD.destination to 6 MSBs of PD.destination

rxpp_fwd_dcf_mirror_cmd_table.desc: Map {SNA.Is-SLB(1), DCF-Data(2), NPPD.ECN (1)} to PD.mirror_code1 (if override is set)

rxpp_fwd_from_term_res_lb_key.desc: Save the Resolution LB Key calculated between the termination and forwarding stages

rxpp_term_issu_states.desc: ISSU State per stage and NPE in the RxPP

rxpp_term_npe_cancel_inc_reg.desc: When an NPE has repetetive parity error on a memory address, this address shouldn't be used.Prior to that,  these registers decrease the number of available threads in an NPE, per phase

rxpp_term_macdb_sm_tcam_mapping_reg.desc: Map the 3 LSBs of the sm_tcam access key, to which DB responses are expected

rxpp_term_macdb_sm_db0_mapping_reg.desc: Map the 5 LSBs of the sm_db0 access key, to which DB responses are expected

rxpp_term_macdb_sm_db1_mapping_reg.desc: Map the 5 LSBs of the sm_db1 access key, to which DB responses are expected

rxpp_term_macdb_vlan_mapping_db_mapping_.desc: Map the 5 LSBs of the vlan_mapping access key, to which DB responses are expected

rxpp_term_dbc_thresholds_reg.desc: The number of remaining free entries in the DB result container, before the lookup access rate of relevant DBs is reduced to 1 every 2 clocks

rxpp_term_bubble_logic_counter_cfg.desc: This block contains Strict-Priority logic for some of the databases. In order to avoid starvation of the lower-priority-databases, a bubble-request will be sent from those in the case their input-fifos are ready, but for more than <x> clocks there was no pop from them. <x> can be different for each database, and is controlled by this register

rxpp_term_debug_data_bus_register.desc: This register will contain selected-data-bus for debug. The selected data is taken from a full data-bus which can be seen in rxpp_term_dbg.v file.

rxpp_term_debug_data_select_register.desc: This reg is the selector of the debug_data_bus

rxpp_term_debug_fifos_water_marks_regist.desc: This register contains the watermark indication of the CBRs and Fifos in the RXDB

rxpp_term_tt0_two_lookups_map.desc: The tunnel termination EM 0,1 tables are exact match tables. The 4-lsb of the EM0.key are mapped to a �Two-Lookups� indication. When set both tunnel termination EM 0 and 1 are accessed in parallel.

slice_sna_program_selection_field_select.desc: 6 field-select-instructions to extract data required to construct the key for the program-selection-reg-tcam

slice_sna_per_slice_cfg_for_sna_modes_se.desc: SNA has few modes of operation: Slice-mode: for calculation the Sequence-number SNR-Outgoing-IF: calculation is defferent according to the mode. This register contains the general-slice-mode and snr-outgoing-if mode in which the slice is being used

slice_sna_per_slice_cfg_for_plb_sna_mode.desc: Specific configuration for {SN-PLB}-SNA-Mode * Valid only on CRF-Fabric-Slices

slice_sna_fs_mode_cfg.desc: According to the Flow-signature, the flow signature is constructed from the flow-vector-hash0 and flow-vector-hash1

slice_sna_per_slice_cfg_for_slb_sna_mode.desc: Specific configuration for {SLB}-SNA-Mode * Valid only on TOR-SLB-Slices

slice_sna_sna_interrupt_array_mask.desc: This register masks sna_interrupt_array interrupt register

slice_sna_sna_interrupt_array_test.desc: This register tests sna_interrupt_array interrupt register

slice_sna_debug_fifos_water_marks_regist.desc: This register contains the watermark indication for the order-fifos

slice_sna_map_fabric_header_type_to_crf_.desc: Per fabric-header, there are 3 valid sna-mode. This register maps the fabric-header-type to this mode * Valid only on CRF-Fabric-slices

slice_sna_map_tm_header_type.desc: per tm-header-type, snr-outgoing-if mode and offset to dest-slice * Valid only on CRF-Fabric-slices

slice_sna_map_destination_slice_to_snr_o.desc: per fabric-header.dest-slice (3b), holds snr-outgoing-interface * Valid only on CRF-Fabric-slices, when mode is 'Extracted'

slice_sna_map_flow_sig_mod_to_snr_outgoi.desc: per ('flow-sig % 3') (2b), holds snr-outgoing-interface * Valid only on TOR-SLB-slices, when mode is 'Flow-sig-Mod'

slice_sna_map_flow_sig_xor_to_snr_outgoi.desc: per (^flow-sig[2:0]) (1b), holds snr-outgoing-interface * Valid only on TOR-SLB-slices, when mode is 'Flow-sig-Xor'

slice_sna_slb_data_extraxtion_reg_tcam_m.desc: SLB data extraction reg-tcam-associated-data: contains the sna-mode and packet-offsets to the slb-required-fields

slice_sna_pp_local_id_table.desc: On PP-mode, the {Port x priority} is mapped to local-id by this table

slice_sna_fls_calculation_program_select.desc: Flow-signatur cauculation: Program-selection-reg-tcam-associated-data: contains 8 field-select instructions:  � 4 byte resolution � 32b output � 4 nibble resolution � 16b output

slice_sna_sna_lu_table.desc: This table is used to store the extracted sna-data untill the context if in the head of the ifg-order-fifos

txpp_power_down_configuration.desc: Power Down Configuration for the block

txpp_spare_reg.desc: Power Down Configuration for the block

txpp_internal_interrupt.desc: Interrupt register for various interrupts in the TxPP

txpp_internal_interrupt_mask.desc: This register masks InternalInterrupt interrupt register

txpp_internal_interrupt_test.desc: This register tests InternalInterrupt interrupt register

txpp_debug_data_bus_register.desc: Debug register. Data selected by debug_data_select_register

txpp_debug_data_select_register.desc: Selector for debug features. The debug data is broken to 32 bit, so bigger data is accessed through several select values

txpp_fabric_mode.desc: Setting the TxPP to Fabric mode. Logic behaves differently in TxPP directed to network and TxPP directed to the fabric.

txpp_egress_slice.desc: Setting the TxPP to Egress mode. Logic behaves differently in Ingress TxPP or Egress TxPP

txpp_parity_err_block_npu_buffer_context.desc: Blocks re-allocating faulty entry. When a weak entry in the NPU buffer is detected, the SW can block using that entry.  Blocking is done by setting the valid bit to 1 and the return context to the number of entry that should be blocked. Unblocking entries requires resetting of the device. Register is duplicate. instance 0 is for NPU buffer0, instance 1 is for NPU buffer1.

txpp_ibm_editing_enable_bmp.desc: This Register holds fields recognising In Bound Mirroring (IBM) commands from the received CUD. It also holds enable switches to IBM related hardware.

txpp_cud_mapping_int_enc_type.desc: The Encapsulation type to be assigned to inband telemetry packets in the CUD stage

txpp_cud_mapping_dcf_enc_type.desc: The Encapsulation type to be assigned to DCF packets in the CUD stage

txpp_cud_mapping_dcf_cud_values.desc: In CUD mapping stage. The cud is recognised as DCF if the 4 msbs of the DCF is one of the three values set in this register. If less than three types is required, than two or more fields should be set to the same value.

txpp_cud_mc_copy_id_range.desc: Mask and value used to determine whether the MC-Copy-ID should be mapped using the mapping table.

txpp_cud_encap_data_offset.desc: Offset to the original Enacsulation Data (108 bits) found in the header before CUD mapping stage.

txpp_cud_encap_data_type_offset.desc: Offset to Encapsulation Type in the NPU Header for ingress replicated unicast header (4 bits)

txpp_cud_encap_data_cud_offset.desc: Offset to CUD id in the NPU header for ingress replicated unicast packets (24 bits)

txpp_cud_encap_data_type_mc_cud_value.desc: Value of Encapsulation Type that corresponds to Ingress Replicated Unicast

txpp_logical_port_mapping_dlp_type.desc: Mapping from Header's forward and encapsution types to logical port type. Addressing the bitmap method: {forward type (4 bits), Encapsulation type (4 bits)}

txpp_npe_mid_res_sec_enc_type_off_sel.desc: Accessing the TCAM of the NPE macro ID uses two encapsulation types. The first is taken from a known place in the NPU Encapsulation header. The second encapsulation type can be found in two locations in the NPU Encapsulation header. This vector maps the first encapsulation type (4 bits) to position selector (1 bit)

txpp_npe_mid_res_sec_enc_type_off.desc: Offset to the second encapsulation type in the NPU Encapsulation header (see description for NpeMidResSecEncTypeOffSel)

txpp_current_layer_bit_index.desc: Translate the first header type of the SOP word (4 bits) to the first layer to be processed in the NPU (4 bits)

txpp_pending_tx_counter_req_in_fifo_thre.desc: Maximum amount of pending tx counters reqs per IFG allowed in the TxPP. Exceeding this number will stop issuing Sop words for the correspoinding IFG.

txpp_non_sop_in_fifo_threshold.desc: Maximum amount of non-sop fragments allowed in the Non-Sop Fifo. When the threshold is not exceeded writing to the NPU Buffer has strict priority for SOP Words. When the threshold is exceeded the Non-SOP words has strict priority over SOP words.

txpp_npu_buffer_full_threshold.desc: Maximal number of words (from all interfaces) allowed in the TxPP per IFG.

txpp_ifg0_ifc_word_mem_alloc.desc: Maximal number of words from txpp's first sms2txpp interface allowed in the TxPP per interface.

txpp_ifg1_ifc_word_mem_alloc.desc: Maximal number of words from txpp's second sms2txpp interface allowed in the TxPP per interface.

txpp_light_fi_npu_sms_msb_align.desc: Enables aligning the NPU header to the msb of the SOP word when exiting the light FI

txpp_light_fi_fabric_lookup.desc: Register Lookup table for the fabric stage in the light FI. Each field contains 16 entries

txpp_light_fi_tm_lookup.desc: Register Lookup table for the TM stage in the light FI. Each field contains 16 entries

txpp_issu_use_cfg_value.desc: Determines the origin of the ISSU to be used at the light FI. A SOP word may leave the light FI if the NPU has a slot to receive it and if the ISSU of the NPU agrees with the ISSU of the light FI. This register determines the origin of the light FI issu. It may be taken from the SOP word going through the light FI or from configuration register IncomingFragIssu_r

txpp_npe_output_grant_to_valid_latency.desc: number of cycles between transmit grant to the npe and the reception of the sop word from the npe

txpp_npe_total_eligible_slots.desc: Maximal Number of SOP words allowed in the NPE (per phase). This register uses to limit the number of SOP in the NPE in case of a bad entry in the NPE.

txpp_npe_input_ready_to_valid_latency.desc: number of cycles between receiving ready from the NPE and the NPE getting valid signal

txpp_npe_input_used_to_pop_latency.desc: number of cycles between receiving ready from the NPE and sending valid

txpp_npe_to_ene_on_the_fly_counter.desc: Number of SOP words found in the logic between after the NPE and before the ENE cluster counter.

txpp_long_termination_disable.desc: Enable bit for the Long termination. Active on low.

txpp_header_type_npu_sms_size.desc: Encoded size of the NPU Header

txpp_fwd_term_sms_hdr_rotate_hdr_en.desc: Enabling the moving of the NPU header to the LSB of the SOP word before of the Encapsulation Engines

txpp_copy_cud_npe_mid_sms_hdr_on_rotated.desc: Replacing the NPU header after the light FI with the NPU header from the CUD mapping. In network mode, the SOP word goes through the NW light FI and the CUD mapping and NPE macro Id resolution stage in parallel. Since the CUD mapping may change the NPU header, the HW can take the NPU header from the CUD mapping and replace it into the SOP word.

txpp_header_type_npu_sms_ive_cmd_offset.desc: Offset to ingress vlan editing offset within the NPU header.

txpp_header_type_npu_sms_ive_pcp_dei_off.desc: Offset to PCP DEI offset within the NPU header.

txpp_npu_header_type_with_ive.desc: Type value of NPU that contains IVE. Only Headers of this type activate the ingress vlan editing.

txpp_npu_header_type_without_ive.desc: Type value of NPU that does not contain IVE. After a SOP word with IVE command finishes the vlan editing, the IVE logic changes it's type to NPU header without IVE type so in case the packet goes through another TxPP (in linecard mode for example) than it won't be edited a second time.

txpp_ive_fwd_data_has_ive.desc: Translates forward type (4 bit) to IVE en (1 bit). Relevant only for NPU headers with IVE.

txpp_post_ene_ipv4_delta_offset_correcti.desc: Correction to the ipv4 delta value coming from the ENE. The ENE may provide a delta to the beginning of an IPv4 header encapsulated in the SOP word. This field allows to add correction of the offset if the encasulation macro add data beyond the IPv4.

txpp_stamp_cud_on_eve.desc: Enables stamping the tx CUD on the EVE position. The stamping is done prior to the packet entering the NPE. This allows the NPE to use the information and afterwards issue an EVE command.

txpp_eve_stage_en_signals.desc: Enable signals for the EVE signals

txpp_light_fi_stages_cfg.desc: lightFI stage configuration register. For stages 4-7 only LightFiUpdateHeaderType is relevant

txpp_ingress_vlan_editing_tpid_mapping.desc: Mapping from TPID profile (2 bits) to TPID (16 bits) for vlan editing

txpp_tod_gen_regs.desc: Tod genaration related register. Tod value may be loaded from outside the TxPP. The loading process is that the new tod value is first written to TodGenNewLoadedPacificTod and then a load signal is sent directly to the tod logic. The new TOD takes effect after the amount of cycles defined in TodGenLoadCmdDelay.

txpp_tod_delay_measurement_threshold.desc: Delay threshold for ECN marking. A threshold value (22 bits) per Traffic class (8 entries)

txpp_cong_on_if_delay_above_th.desc: ECN marking cause cong on marking

txpp_time_stamp_cmd_translation.desc: Translates from time stamp command (4 bits) to logic controls (8 bits). Each control entry is built as follows: {operation(4), update-UDP-CS(1), reset-UDP-CS(1), Ifg TS cmd(2)}

txpp_counter_stamp_enable.desc: Translates Loss measurement command (4 bits) to Packet counter stamping Enable (1 bit). Uses only Rx LM counters.

txpp_counter_stamp_width.desc: Translates Loss measurement command (4 bits) to stamping width (1 bit). Uses for RX and Tx LM counters.

txpp_dbc_threshold_free_entries_therslod.desc: The number of remaining free entries in the DB result container, before the lookup access rate of relevant DBs is reduced to 1 every 2 clocks

txpp_tod_device_time_udp_cs_offset.desc: Offset to the UDP CS from the Time stamp command in the NPU header. Value may be negative.

txpp_tod_external_regs.desc: External regs written by a TOD record command

txpp_ingress_vlan_editing_control.desc: Translates Vlan editing command to logic controls

txpp_delay_measurement_cmd.desc: Translates pif and traffic class to delay measurement command. Uses for max delay measurement and delay histograms

txpp_mc_copy_id_map.desc: This memory is used in CUD mapping stage, for the case where the MC copy ID is the encapsulation data. Accessing this memory is done by the 6 MSBs of the MC copy ID

txpp_light_fi_npu_base_lookup.desc: Register Lookup table for the NPU base stage in the light FI.

txpp_light_fi_npu_encap_lookup.desc: Register Lookup table for the NPU Encap stage in the light FI.

txpp_npe_mid_res_tcam_mem.desc: NPE macro id res tcam associated data

txpp_cbr_fifos.desc: Memory for the CBR in the incoming SMS interface

txpp_light_fi_nw_lookup_table_tcam.desc: light fi nw lookup table tcam

txpp_light_fi_nw_lookup_table_tcam_mem.desc: light fi nw lookup table tcam associated data

txpp_fwd_qos_mapping.desc: Hold Forward Quality of Service tags

txpp_encap_qos_mapping.desc: Hold Encapsulation Quality of Service tags

txpp_npu_buffer.desc: Buffer for words waiting for reordering

pdoq_wrrqsn.desc: Write request sequence number, entry per queue. Each entry is initialized to the entry number (in order to prevent pressure on the first exact-match core). The sequence number is incremented by the write-queue-manager (RMW) every enqueue-command, R+W (Two ports) memory.

pdoq_wrsn.desc: Write sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number.  The sequence number increments every write report (read-increment-write) and read every De-queue command, 2R+W memory.

pdoq_wrbc.desc: Write bytes and buffers count, entry per queue, initialized to 0.  The write bytes and buffers count is incremented (RMW) in packet size every write-report and read every dequeue-command, 2R+W memory.

pdoq_rdrqsn.desc: Read request sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number. The sequence number is incremented (RMW) every read-request command and written to an old sequence number value in case the ICS asks for retransmit (on dequeue-command).

pdoq_rdsn.desc: Read sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number.  The sequence number is incremented every dequeue-command from the ICS and read every enqueue-command by the write-queue-manager.

pdoq_rdbc.desc: Read bytes count, entry per queue, initialized to 0. The read bytes count is incremented (RMW) with the packet size every dequeue-command from the ICS, and read every enqueue-command, 2R+W memory.

pdoq_rqm_free_fifo.desc: Fifo for requests of EM entries release after the packet was read

pdoq_crbal_a.desc: Credit balance memory for IFG0 queues. The credit balance is increased every credit grant, and decreased every successful deq

pdoq_crbal_b.desc: Credit balance memory for IFG1 queues. The credit balance is increased every credit grant, and decreased every successful deq

pdoq_enq_qsize.desc: Queue byte size memory of ENQ reports. Used by DEQ controller for comparing to credit balance.

pdoq_deq_qsize.desc: Queue byte size memory of DEQ reports. Used by DEQ controller for comparing to credit balance.

pdoq_retrans_filter.desc: Retransmit filter - stores last PD SN per Queue, and filter status

pdoq_oq_ifc_mapping.desc: OQ Map Data. Accessed by OQ pair. Stores Destination physical interface (IFG port), TxPPMapData (by default OQ number per IFG) and FCN profile for accounting in MarkCounterReg

pdoq_oq_profile.desc: Per OQ pair profile, used by Dequeue controller for Credit Balance thresholds

pdoq_pfc_mapping.desc: PFC mapping configuration. Address is (ifg 1b, port 5b, priority 3b) / 4. Each entry holds 4 logical entries. Each logical entry represents mapping to OQ number and 8b bitmap that allows the OQ to affect up to 8 neighbor OQ - OQ+1, � , OQ+7

pdoq_fcn.desc: Stores FCN marking data received from TxCGM per OQ

pdoq_fcn_oqg.desc: Stores FCN marking data received from TxCGM per OQG

pdoq_eligible_status_a.desc: Store number of inflight PDs and PD size per Q for eligible list use, IFG0 queues

pdoq_eligible_status_b.desc: Store number of inflight PDs and PD size per Q for eligible list use, IFG1 queues

pdoq_read_report_fifo.desc: Fifo for read report data received from the database

pdoq_read_rate_limiter.desc: Packet rate limitation for Read access to the database. Avoids packet burst for slow interfaces.

pdvoq_slice_cpu_return_context.desc: CPU return context to the dynamic context allocation machine. One use is in case of aged out queue.

pdvoq_slice_cpu_return_context_status.desc: CPU may/may-not return context to the dynamic context allocation machine. One use is in case of aged out queue.

pdvoq_slice_buffers_consumption_lut_for_.desc: LUT for dequeue marking in VOQ-CGM based on Buffer Consumption. Index in Array is {Profile,BufferAvailableLevel} Profile is 5 bits BufferAvailableLevel is quantized to 2 bits.

pdvoq_slice_pd_consumption_lut_for_deq.desc: LUT for dequeue marking in VOQ-CGM based on Pd Consumption. Decision is taken from offset {Profile,PktAvailableLevel} Profile is 5 bits PktAvailableLevel is quantized to 2 bits.

pdvoq_slice_voq_cgm_enq_time_fifo_cfg.desc: Config Register for fifo that stores the enq time of a PD between read report and Deq Cmd

pdvoq_slice_rdrqsn.desc: Read request sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number. The sequence number is incremented (RMW) every read-request command and written to an old sequence number value in case the ICS asks for retransmit (on dequeue-command).

pdvoq_slice_rdsn.desc: Read sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number.  The sequence number is incremented every dequeue-command from the ICS and read every enqueue-command by the write-queue-manager.

pdvoq_slice_rdbc.desc: Read bytes count, entry per queue, initialized to 0. The read bytes count is incremented (RMW) with the packet size every dequeue-command from the ICS, and read every enqueue-command, 2R+W memory.

pdvoq_slice_rdbufcnt.desc: Similar to rdbc but in SMS buffers. CGM need to know the queue size in SMS buffer units. SMS buffer is 384B.

pdvoq_slice_wrrqsn.desc: Write request sequence number, entry per queue. Each entry is initialized to the entry number (in order to prevent pressure on the first exact-match core). The sequence number is incremented by the write-queue-manager (RMW) every enqueue-command, R+W (Two ports) memory.

pdvoq_slice_wrsn.desc: Write sequence number, entry per queue, each entry is initialized to the entry number.  The sequence number increments every write report (read-increment-write) and read every De-queue command, 2R+W memory.

pdvoq_slice_wrbc.desc: Write bytes count, entry per queue, initialized to 0.  The write bytes count is incremented (RMW) in packet size every write-report and read every dequeue-command, 2R+W memory.

pdvoq_slice_wrbufcnt.desc: Similar to wrbc but in SMS buffers. CGM need to know the queue size in SMS buffer units. SMS buffer is 384B.

pdvoq_slice_voq2context.desc: context per voq. Managed by the context mapper.  Read by ICS when it receives credit-grant and need to translate the VOQ\# to context.

pdvoq_slice_cand_rel_fifo.desc: Fifo to hold context\# released by the ICS

pdvoq_slice_in_cand_rel_fifo_set.desc: The context resides in the CandRelFifo - set-clear-read to prevent double entries in the fifo

pdvoq_slice_in_cand_rel_fifo_clr.desc: The context resides in the CandRelFifo - set-clear-read to prevent double entries in the fifo

pdvoq_slice_context_release_eligible_set.desc: The context is empty and thus ready for release SCRP

pdvoq_slice_context_release_eligible_clr.desc: The context is empty and thus ready for release SCRP

pdvoq_slice_context_in_dram_set.desc: The context is in the DRAM and thus it is not ready for release SCR

pdvoq_slice_context_in_dram_clr.desc: The context is in the DRAM and thus it is not ready for release SCR

pdvoq_slice_context_map_valid_set.desc: The context is mapped to VOQ (SCR)

pdvoq_slice_context_map_valid_clr.desc: The context is mapped to VOQ (SCR)

pdvoq_slice_contextfbm_bmp.desc: bitmap memory for the free buffer manager

pdvoq_slice_new_voq_set.desc: This context is a new-voq (first credit grant did not arrive / first PD was not transmitted)

pdvoq_slice_new_voq_clr.desc: This context is a new-voq (first credit grant did not arrive / first PD was not transmitted)

pdvoq_slice_voq_properties.desc: context per voq. Managed by the context mapper.  Read by ICS when it receives credit-grant and need to translate the VOQ\# to context.

pdvoq_slice_static_mapping.desc: Mark the static context so they want be reused - returned to the pool

pdvoq_slice_context2voq.desc: credit allocate read port for credit grant

pdvoq_slice_rqm_free_fifo.desc: fifo for dequeue between RQM and the EMCs

pdvoq_slice_voqcgm_profile.desc: Dynamic CGM profile per context used by voq_cgm

pdvoq_slice_profile_buff_region_threshol.desc: Per Profile Thresholds for max queue size in buffers to be included in Region X. i.e. if QsizeBuffRegion0 < QsizeBuff <= QsizeBuffRegion1 then the region is 1. If QsizeBuffRegion6 < QsizeBuff the region is 7

pdvoq_slice_profile_pkt_region_threshold.desc: Per Profile Thresholds for max queue size in PDs to be included in Region X. i.e. if QsizePktRegion0 < QsizePkts <= QsizePktRegion1 then the region is 1. If QsizePktRegion6 < QsizePkts the region is 7

pdvoq_slice_profile_pkt_enq_time_region_.desc: Per Profile Thresholds for Voq-Delay to be in Region X. i.e. if PdEnqTimeRegion0 < Qdelay <= PdEnqTimeRegion1 then region is 1. If PdEnqTimeRegion14 < Qdelay region is 15

pdvoq_slice_buffers_consumption_lut_for_.desc: CGM Enqueue test LUT for queue size in buffers. The result of the test is a decision for DropGreen, DropYellow, EvictToDram and CongestionMark. Every entry in memory holds 16 bits for each decision type and the final decision is selected based on the 4 bit quantized queue delay level. Address in memory is: {Profile,DramContextAvailable,RxpdrIngressCounterRegion,VoqSizeBuffersLevel} Profile is 5 bits. DramContextAvailable is 1 bit and is received from the ICS. RxpdrIngressCounterRegion is 2 bits of Rxpdr's CounterA Utilization level. VoqSizeBuffersLevel is 3 bits and is the quantized queue size in buffers based on ProfileBuffRegionThresholds Memory.

pdvoq_slice_pd_consumption_lut_for_enq.desc: CGM Enqueue test LUT for queue size in PDs. The result of the test is a decision for DropGreen, DropYellow, EvictToDram and CongestionMark. Every entry in memory holds 16 bits for each decision type and the final decision is selected based on the 4 bit quantized queue delay level. Address in memory is: {Profile,PdvoqPdCounter0Level,VoqSizePdsLevel} CGM logic implemented in memory. Profile is 5 bits. PdvoqPdCounter0Level is 2 bits of PDVOQ's PD Counter 0  Utilization level. VoqSizePdsLevel is 3 bits and is the quantized queue size in PDs based on ProfilePktRegionThresholds Memory.

pdvoq_slice_voq_enq_rpt_size_for_enq.desc: Enq Report Qsize region per context for Enq pipe

pdvoq_slice_voq_deq_rpt_size_for_enq.desc: Deq Report Qsize region per context for Enq pipe

For example in slice X and for n <= 3: If VoqNumber >= MinVoq[X*4+n] and VoqNumber <= MaxVoq[X*4+n] then CGM events (drop/mark/etc) will be accounted for in VoqCounters[X*4+n] register.

Example of UCH fifo values: PlbFifoStartAddr of fifo n+1 = PlbFifoStartAddr of fifo n + RlbUchFifoSize NOTE: the block should perform soft reset after changing this register
